title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Online interview during lockdown. It was smooth with 2 people online took around thirty to fourth five minutes. Before the interview there was a call to set up the dates and to verify the qualifications.
Interview Questions: General vision about the the mission of the organization and the reaches they have.

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Very, very thorough. Be prepared for 3-4 interviewers for maybe 90+ mins. This is a great organization. I was willing to reduce my salary but in the end felt the job was not a good fit.
Interview Questions: Very detailed questions about any situation that could ever arise.

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Bridgeport, CT)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process exceeds expectations with its comprehensive and rigorous approach, setting a higher standard for evaluating candidates. The interview process exceeds expectations with its comprehensive and rigorous approach, setting a higher standard for evaluating candidates.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lending Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Denver, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy and quick hiring process. Quick responses. I first had a phone interview for the first screening, and then I had one more panel interview where I was interviewed by two people.
Interview Questions: What draws you to Habitat? They will also ask a lot of scenario questions where you need to give examples.

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a telephone screening with the recruiter. The recruiter was pleasant, but didn't seem to be at the expected professional level searching for someone in the CEO Office. Second interview was with two senior leaders and went well. It was quick, but efficient and professional. Four weeks passed after the second interview, so I emailed the recruiter to ask about my status, but the recruiter never responded.  Ghosted!  Six weeks later, still no response. Pretty low level of professionalism and not a good representation of the CEO's office.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward online one on one interview, asked me questions about coursework/experience relating to the position, why I was interested in it, etc. Only talked to one person for the interview and then I heard back about 1.5/2 weeks later
Interview Questions: Have you had any prior experience relating to this position?

title: Financial and Home Ownership Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the HR rep was very pleasant. They ask, why one is interested in the position and if they have prior experience. Also, what personal qualities outside of work, makes one best for the role.
Interview Questions: What qualities outside of work, will make you perfect for this role?

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Inconsistent with the advertised understanding of what the process would entail. Some of the staff involved were very difficult to communicate with, while others were very well balanced. Thank you.
Interview Questions: My most challenging experience that I learned from.

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The HR representative and the CEO had very little idea about the Marketing position & couldn't answer questions about the position. You could tell they were uncomfortable when I asked questions related to the position.
Interview Questions: They read off the job description and would ask me if I knew how to do items on the job description without checking on my resume that I listed that experience, They were ill-prepared for the interview,

title: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Kansas City, MO) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Simple, perhaps too simple. Semi-transparent process. Initial phone screener with the primary point of contact. Limited interpersonal time with the CEO Search Committee - less than 45 minutes, multi-person interview. No proactive updates as the process went past its deadline. Provided a form letter final response with no direct outreach.
Interview Questions: There were multiple areas ID'd as critical like retail operations, executive leadership, financial management, etc..

title: Global Entrepreneurship & Innovation Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (London, England) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to a first stage of interview remotely held (the role was UK based) and it did go well, basic questions about previous experience. Got cheered for my current experience, so I was very positive about getting a second stage. I had been told I would have been informed after a week or so, got ghosted. Never heard back.
Interview Questions: Basic previous experience and interest for the company.

title: Public Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The process consisted of a phone screen followed by a video interview with the hiring manager, then a team interview followed by an interview exercise. The process was a little lengthy, but the team is small and wanted to make sure they were choosing the right candidate. Everyone was so nice from start to finish and communication was always there!
Interview Questions: What three adjectives would you use to describe yourself?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Spartanburg, SC) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: It took a long time to go through the process. The process was a little disorganized and confusing. However, the staff and Executive Director were great and asked great questions.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses Describe an event you would put on. Why would you want to work there?

title: Project Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening with recruiter followed by zoom interview with senior management, and in person meeting with construction supervisor at the project site in San Francisco. Interview was fairly straight forward and friendly
Interview Questions: What is your experience with Procore and Microsoft Project?

title: Truck Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: It was relaxed and the  managers asked about experience, skills, no DUI's, no drugs, etc. I felt good about the process. I have not heard back yet but am satisfied how it went.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have for the position?

title: Assistant Public Funding Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very slow, the hiring process took about 2 months. The team seems friendly. The HR was helpful.  The interview was focused on getting to know me personally, rather than more professionally.
Interview Questions:
Can you give an example of a time you solved a conflict with a colleague?
Why do you want to work here?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Long interview process. The initial interviews are more about company culture, ethics, diversity and inclusion, etc. then, the next round includes several interviews with your actual team (finance or counterparts). I found it to be a bit extensive.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for our company?

title: Public Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to a 15 minute phone screen via Teams without video.  The second interview was with the Director, camera on only lasted 30 mins. The final interview was  a panel with the PR team; everyone was very nice, friendly and engaging.  The questions were mainly about my experience and work style.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Grant Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Omaha, NE) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: First interview was by phone for about 40 minutes. A second interview was set up to meet the manager. The HR employee stated she would get back to me with more details, she never did. After reaching out to her, she still didn't contact me. I was ghosted.
Interview Questions: What is  your editorial experience? Also, how do I express being detail-oriented in my life outside of work? Which I thought was a poor question.

title: Donation Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Bellingham, WA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process. I sat at a table with several of their employees who asked me questions. They gave me a call the next day. I decided to take the job.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths on the job?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Thorough and interesting screening call with Talent Acquisition that was followed by interview with hiring manager who had a clear vision. From there, I had interviews with key stakeholders.  Impressed by talent, commitment and energy of members.
Interview Questions: Hiring Manager's dovetailed with job description. Stakeholders each had a specific need/interest in experience related to their roles/needs.

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The entire process was pretty straightforward. I applied online and then waited to hear from HR. After some emails back and forth an interview was scheduled. At the time, everything was done virtually. Overall, the entire process was easy to navigate.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your past experiences.

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. Scheduled and occured on time. Representative was very friendly and engaging. We discussed my experience and what I was looking for and then she discussed what they were looking for. All went well. It was a pleasant process overall.
Interview Questions: What did you like best about your prior position?

title: Senior Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Started with general questions on experience from previous employment, followed by topic-specific related questions on project development and project management. The interviewers also asked me to do a short presentation (much more like a pitch) on project proposal I designed one week prior to the interview process.
Interview Questions: (i) Experience in humanitarian projects; (ii)

title: Senior Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: I had one phone interview as well as two in person interviews. The questions were standard. I received an job offer, but I did not accept due to benefits package.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with Google Analytics?

title: Programme Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen,  interview with the hiring manager,  "final" interview with panel.  The interviews with both the hiring manager and the panel were awkward verging on unprofessional - lots of discussion that veered into the personal, an off-putting amount of time spent by the interviewer talking about themselves.  Interview questions were frequently leading--along the lines of "Do you like (x)?".  No discussion of competencies,  no opportunity to offer examples. Finally,  hiring manager responded to follow up email and punted to HR rep,  who then never replied. Did I get an offer?  Your guess is as good as mine.
Interview Questions: Do you like working with people with different backgrounds?

title: Executive Director, Non-Profit Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview with head of search committee first, then eventually met with all staff. They were able to ask anything, pertaining to the work, and conversations were had about all things regarding leadership, employees, and how the two meet.
Interview Questions: What will I do when an employee has an idea to improve and the board doesn't like the idea?

title: Executive Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: It was a lengthy process for the hiring director and the VP and their direct reports. Several roles + powerpoint presentation were created to display your written skills and ability to navigate through different tech platforms.
Interview Questions: I cannot recall what the questions were

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I went through a total of 8 interviews... 1 preliminary with HR and then another 7 with various members from their finance team. I was still working with my previous employer at that time and at 30 minutes each, I spent approximately 4+ hours of my time, to not even get a response when the interview process was concluded. 

That was the most frustrating aspect. To devote so much time in my schedule for their thorough interview process, to not even receive an email from them stating that I was not selected for the position. For a supposed "Christian" company, I would have expected more. I believe in following things through to the end and being transparent & honest. For these reasons, I do not believe I would have been happy long-term had I received a job offer from Habitat for Humanity. 

Ultimately, I believe that everything happens for a reason. I accepted a job offer with a company that I love working for and feel valued with.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Habitat for Humanity?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Houston, TX) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Smooth respectful and to the point ,the people there seem friendly and helpful . I’m just about to start working there but so far based of the interview it seem like a good place to work . Especially since we get to learn new thing we could apply in the real world
Interview Questions: Not many just why you would like to work there

title: Director of Business Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was thorough, but the HR staff made an active effort to focus on my background — there was little deviation from the context of my resume and background, which was useful to establishing a relationship with them from the outset.
Interview Questions: Heavy emphasis placed on “what would you do”-type scenarios.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Easy to work with, professional and organized. A great experience. Our office will participate again in the future. I didn’t feel shamed about my lack of skill and the teamwork was inspiring. Will recommend to others.
Interview Questions: What types of skills do you have on a build site?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward, very friendly, I was able to comfortably talk about my experiences. One round of one on one interview, then they contacted about a week and a half later
Interview Questions: Have you had previous experience before with our issues?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Call after receiving application and given the option to meet in person or online. Interviewed by a panel of current workers in their office. Interview discussed the role and basic job interview questions.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Habitat for Humanity?

title: Credit Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Really enjoyable interview process with a series of one-on-one interviews with people that I am now working with on a daily basis. Certainly want to know about qualifications but there a great focus on your desire to join an organization like Habitat.
Interview Questions: Asked about you desire to serve Habitat's mission for affordable shelter for all.

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions. The individual who interviewed me was very friendly. Had one zoom interview and they decided to go with a candidate who was local to the area.  Would apply again.
Interview Questions: Tell me how your experience relates to this position

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The first call was a screening call with the HR Team and it was fairly straightforward - no hard-hitting questions. The second conversation was a one-hour call with a member of the team. The third day was a series of three 30-minute interviews, two with higher-ups and one with an HR member.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you exerted courage, humility and accountability at a past job

title: Family Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the job. There was an excel proficiency test required with the Indeed application submission. The following morning I received an email from the executive director followed by a text from him asking for an interview same day. Umm no, I work. I scheduled for a few days out. I was completed thrown off that my first interview was essentially a show and tell car ride seeing job sites and getting a high level overview about HFH. 

After the first interview I immediately received an email asking for a second interview. I was surprised and accepted. During the second interview I was asked standard questions but a lot focusing on conflict with superiors. Definitely seems like a toxic environment has previously occurred. 

Left the second interview and was asked to email my references. All three references said they would let me know when they reached out. None of my references were called. It’s now been a month and never heard back. Just saw online they filled the position. 

For a Christian non-profit organization I’m very disappointed in their lack of communication after 2 interviews and references being requested. I’d suggest passing on this organization.
Interview Questions: What do you know about HFH

title: Volunteer Experience Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The process was great. I had an interview with the HR manager and then HR & Department lead then the CEO. That was a bit stressful but the whole process was very casual.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your experience that relates to the role.

title: VP-Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Very thoughtful - met with ceo and then a panel. Panel had planned ahead on which questions they would ask and who would ask them. Hard to get a read on how my responses were resonating but the team seemed very friendly. Second round was another well-prepared panel.
Interview Questions: What charities do you most admire?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: A group of 3 people interviewing and asking you questions, and you of course are giving a response. Feedback on certain safety and rules and regulations when working on houses and what operations must be done
Interview Questions: Questions more so regarding my past work history and background.

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Applied on Indeed. Had two in-person interviews. Process was smooth and communication was good. I followed up with questions by email, and my interviewer responded promptly. There was some back and forth around salary and benefits what the situation was resolved.
Interview Questions: Behavioral, answered using STAR method.

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a phone screening with the recruiter, a phone interview with the hiring manager, and an on-site day of interviews with various members of the staff that the position interfaced with. I find this process to be standard among a few companies I have interviewed with.
Interview Questions: Situational questions around how I would handle a comms scenario.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with two people over video call, with cameras turned off. Fairly straight forward questions and friendly interviewers. They went with someone with more experience, but were quick to let me know.
Interview Questions: What does diversity and inclusion mean to you?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: First round of interview was pretty straighfoward. Asked about your work history, why are you drawn to the organization.  Talked more about the role, salary range. Automatic, generic e-mail response if you do not make it to the next round.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this role?

title: ReStore Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Fresno, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Amazing. I was treated with  the utmost respect. It was a phone interview. The manager was very kind and considerate. The organization places importance on how employees are treated. I highly recommend people looking at Habitat for Humanity for a job. They have a wonderful culture.
Interview Questions: What do you want out of life?

title: System Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Initial phone interview and then a video interview with the CTO. Very informal. Not really a surprise considering it’s a non-profit. 

After the interview with the CTO I sent two follow up emails and didn’t get a response. That’s unacceptable in my eyes, and says everything about the company.
Interview Questions: Basic sys admin stuff. I remember that the CTO really wanted someone with a lot of Azure experience to lead their future cloud migrations, but my experience there was limited.

title: Family Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Submit resume and cover letter through Indeed. First interview with Executive Director and then a second interview with 2 volunteer members of the Family Services Committee, one of whom held the position of Coordinator in the past.
Interview Questions: How would you approach a delinquent client who is late on submitting forms or a payment?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great, they were able to answer all questions and provide clarity on the role and direction of the organization.  Based on the interview I would recommend them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want the role

title: Global People Team Transformation Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Unimpressive process. Interview for a high level position with international scope, conducted in a very unprofessional manner by a recent hire. Multiple interviews, posted the opportunity as remote only to "ding" you for not wishing to relocate. Let you progress far into the process and not select you with ZERO feedback as to why. At this level of opportunity, it is expected that solid feedback will be given.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Habitat for Humanity?

title: Computer Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was easy. I had two interviews and both times I felt at easy and everyone was easy to talk too. I highly recommend this organization. You will have to interview with multiple people.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Several questions were asked by the interviewer. Everything went swiftly. The interviewer was very kind and well-mannered. The interviewer also offered to provide a cup of coffee or tea, which helped ease the interview process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Habitat for Humanity?

title: Public Funding Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen interview was about 30 minutes with HR, followed by a 1-hour interview with the same HR professional and supervisor of the position applied for over a Zoom video conferencing call.
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you had a disagreement with a superior and how it was resolved.

title: Retail Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Easy in-person conversation. Tour facility, met other staff and volunteers, talked about schedule. Shared my past experience and interest in the part-time job. Flexibility in schedule was important to balance family responisbilities.
Interview Questions: Experience in customer service, mission focus

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: They all seemed like nice people to work with. They extended the job offer to me, and then out of nowhere left me a voice-mail and rescinded the offer. Never returned my calls or emails, I was totally ghosted. Overall though feel like I dodged a bullet.
Interview Questions: They had a practical application for indesign and social media.

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Saint Paul, MN) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had a 20ish minute interview with someone over the phone. They were friendly and asked basic questions. Even though I wasn't offered the job they sent me a nice email wishing me well.
Interview Questions: They asked about past experience, why I wanted the job, and why I thought I'd be good for the job.

title: Digital Media Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: I got the position by applying through UVA's IPP program. During the interview with habitat for humanity, make sure you know what habitat for humanity is and what they do. Be prepared to talk about your passions and strengths.
Interview Questions:
Have you worked with Habitat for Humanity before?
What's your strength?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Greenville, SC) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my resume and cover letter, I was quickly asked to come in for an interview. I drove 4 hours to the Greenville, SC office and met with the Development Team. I was asked basic interview questions with just a couple of job-specific questions. Then, in about a week, I was asked to return to Greenville to meet other department heads for a second interview. This was almost an exact repeat of the first interview, with basic questions.
Interview Questions:
What could you bring that this Development Team could not live without?
Why non-profit?
How do you work best, as an individual or in a team?
How would you describe your ideal work environment?
What is your biggest regret/ best choice?
What frustrates you at work?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was typical with a few situational questions, past experiences, and logistical questions. The interviewer was very kind, and was keen to answer any questions I had. There was only one interview total.
Interview Questions: What are 3 adjectives employers would describe you as?

title: Government Relations Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by recruiter after submitting online application. The interview was not conducted specifically with information about the position, it was a general interview. They did not reach out after the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe your duties at your current job.

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Fast application and interview process. My application was in for a week or so before they contacted me for an interview. Did one in person interview and one virtual interview. They contacted me shortly after the second interview, within a few days.
Interview Questions: If I had construction experience.

title: U S Transformation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions:
4 Phases: phone screen, phone interview with hiring manager, virtual interview with Sr. Director - U.S. Transformation, final virtual interview with VP - U.S. & Canada Operations

Overall communication at the beginning and end of the process was rough. The process also took over a month and a half, far too long for an entry-level position.
Interview Questions:
What drew you to apply for this position?

How has your past experience prepared you for this role?

How do you organize your work when juggling multiple responsibilities?

Tell us about a situation when you weren't clear on what was needed from you. How did you handle that?

What do you look for in a manager?

title: Project Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Hendersonville, NC) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: 2 phone calls & 1 in-person interview. In-person interview was on site, casual, & mostly detailed the responsibilities of the job. Phone calls were more formal but still fairly relaxed.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable managing older volunteers?

title: Americorps Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through both HFHI and AmeriCorps federal website, received information about a phone interview through the affiliate, then moved onto the final round. Worked with the Habitat International team to figure out final efforts and placement, the talent team at HFHI could not be more helpful.
Interview Questions: What experiences have prepared you for this position?

title: Construction Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straightforward, about an hour long and consisted of a mix of standard interview questions and job-specific scenario questions. HR, the Project Manger and the Department Director were present.
Interview Questions: What do you do if someone does not follow your instructions?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening took place the end of March 2021, with indication that I would have a second interview done in early April.  The end of April I received an e-mail stating the process was taking a bit longer, but would still be scheduled an interview.  The end of May I received an e-mail that they moved on with another candidate.  Very little communication.
Interview Questions: Phone interview was general questions about your background.

title: Construction Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was very lengthy with weeks to months of no contact before finding out whether or not you move on to the next round. The questions in each round were very similar, just with different interviewers.
Interview Questions: What does working for Habitat mean to you?

title: Constituent Engagement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with HR. She was super sweet and asked a few questions pertaining to the position. She informed me during the phone interview, that I would be moving on towards the second interview. My second interview is set up for next week.
Interview Questions:
What experience do you have with volunteer services? 
 
Are you familiar with HFH?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was less structured than others. More of a conversation and less of a back and forth question and answer format. Lovely hiring staff, super nice and addressed all of my questions about the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your most recent work experience.

title: Director of Thought Leadership Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR Phone interview with hiring manager Writing assignment Video interviews with department heads Final interview with hiring manager/ leadership Very communicative and quick responses. Approximately a 4 week process
Interview Questions: How would you pitch a Habitat executive to participate on a speaking panel?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was extensive, friendly but sometimes inconsistent.   Much time passed between interviews and follow ups with also inconsistent communication from focal points.  There was minimum or no feedback provided.
Interview Questions: why did you apply to the position?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Kingsport, TN) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I completed an application form, then met with a four members of the Board of Directors and also completed a personality profile. I also toured two ReStores with one board member. From when I first applied until I heard a response, it took more than 3 months.
Interview Questions: How do you create, track, and manage a nonprofit budget?

title: Sales/Warehouse Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Edmonton, AB) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Overall the interview was a good experience, the hiring manager was very friendly, and so was the assistant manager. But when I had arrived, I asked an employee where the hiring manager was, the employee seemed to be annoyed with me, she gave me an attitude for no reason.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work for Habitat for Humanity?

title: Finance Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Maseru) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Fair and relaxed. they  tested more on internal Controls
and disbursement processes. data analysis was bit tricky but all in all the interview was fair. they give the  feed back like they have promised
Interview Questions: i was askes to Describe Budget process

title: Project Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for this position and was contacted by a member of neighborhood revitalization team. It was a brief phone screening, where the interviewer discussed the position and asked very general questions about my work experience and background.
Interview Questions: What type of experience do you have with data analysis and visualization?

title: Volunteer Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed, great experience. They allowed you to talk as much as needed to answer the question, no leading questions, allowed time to just chat and get to know you.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict between volunteers?

title: Research Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Well the interview was actually quicker than I expected. I came in prepared and did my background check on the organization but we actually jumped straight to the role and salary discussion.
Interview Questions: Can you avail yourself to travel?

title: Painting/Rehab Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Saint Paul, MN) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I did a pre-interview on the phone with a lovely human. It went well. She set up an in-person interview at the Saint Paul location. The manager and the employee I'd be temporarily replacing asked me questions/facilitated a conversation at an overwhelmingly long table.
Interview Questions: At the end of the interview I asked if there was any reason they wouldn't hire me--anything I could clear up or have a chance to discuss further. They said, "no," then never followed up. I think I may have been overqualified and didn't affirm how badly I might need the job. I didn't need the job, I just wanted the job as I knew I had a skillset (construction) and heart that would add value to the clients they were serving.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds - first via email. Only one in-person interview with 3 people at the head office. First round via email was answering some simple questions, with a 48hour window to reply. I found they took a long time to get back to me after each interview round.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you worked well on a team

title: Housing Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Gulfport, MS) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a two interview process. The first interview was with the immediate supervisor and the second interview was with the executive director. Very responsive during the process. They narrowed the field to several top candidates.
Interview Questions: What is a mistake you made in the past?

title: Technical Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone screen with HR.  Then a phone call with the hiring manager.  Then on site and met with 4 different groups, some one on one and some with multiple people.  Very nice and welcoming.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about a major project that you were in charge of and what was the outcome of that project?  
A few technical questions about how to run queries for data and knowledge about databases.

title: Director of Construction Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Indianapolis, IN) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Multi-phase, multi-day process. 1 phone interview, one in person interview, 3 in-person interviews. Went through entire process, as a highly qualified candidate. It took 4 weeks. I had over 8 hours of interview time, and they hired an internal candidate. It was clear that they only used me to check a box that said they went through a hiring process. Unethical interview practices that wasted a lot of my time. I even went out of my way to take time off of my current job, and made arrangements to have my daughter picked up from school after they moved the last interview day a week earlier than originally scheduled. They also have no process for hiring, as they do not have a human resources department. The 2nd interview was 3 directors that had no idea how to conduct an interview. Clearly a massive disconnect among departments and poor leadership during the process. Nice enough people, but need true business instruction.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience

title: Product Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my cover letter and resume via e-mail I was called for a telephonic interview. The interviewer seemed as if they were reading up questions from a script rather than being genuinely interested in knowing what my background is. They were supposed to get back by end of the week but didn't and when I followed up, I received a one-liner stating that I haven't been selected. They are not obligated to inform of their decision even after an interview I guess, but I would've expected an organization like Habitat for 'Humanity' to be a bit more considerate towards a job-seeker when informing them of the result. Automated rejection emails from organizations have better wording
Interview Questions: Standard set of behavioral questions

title: Marketing & Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Austin, TX) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews: one on the phone and two in person. The process took about a month, and the interviews went very well. However, even though I emailed to thank the interviewer for their time, I never heard back either way about my standing for the role. I even followed up a couple of weeks after but was completely ghosted. I get that things can change within a company, but this felt unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and your professional background

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very clear and straightforward. There was an initial interview with HR and a second interview with the hiring team. The initial interview was a phone screening then I was invited to the office for an in-person interview with the team.
Interview Questions: Questions were pretty specific to the team

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was friendly and relaxed. After submitting my application, I was called in for a written test. The test was in the form of a presentation for the project I had applied. I had to then present this at the interview. This was followed up by interview questions.
Interview Questions:
Q. Why do you want to apply for this position?
Q. Are you comfortable with relocating since this is a field based job?
Q. What are areas you would require more support to better carry out you role?

title: Donor Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: It took around 2 weeks the process after I sent my resume. They were really nice, the only thing I didn't like is that after the interview I sent a thank you note and didn't get replied and I had to send another email to check if I was selected as nobody notify before.
Interview Questions: If the money wouldn't be a problem, what would you like to spend your time?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Business Casual dress code. Basic questions to know your hands-on skills such as carpentry, floor laying, roofing, use of power tools, wall partitioning, etc. They inquired your non-available working days and time in a month
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Habitat for Humanity?

title: Marketing and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted over the phone and then invited in to interview in person. Everyone was incredibly nice and kind, over the phone and in person. I brought writing samples, articles that were published nationally and internationally, as well as a publication I was founder/editor of that I created from scratch. I invested a significant amount of time, from applying, driving, and taking a full day to come to Philadelphia for the interview, which I thought, had went extremely well. 

Afterward, I sent a thank-you follow-up email and never received a word back. It was disappointing because I believe if someone was brought in to be interviewed, the least a company or organization could do is get back to them, especially after an extremely kind thank you note. I would have expected that from Habitat for Humanity, but I received nothing.
Interview Questions:
This is a paraphrase, but I was caught off guard by this particular question, and somewhat offended. I didn't want to harp on it, but I was surprised someone would ask me something like this, considering my faith calls me to love all, which was one of the reasons I applied for the job...

"From your background, you seem like someone who is of Christian faith. Many of the families we help are of other races and some are particularly Muslim. Would you have a problem helping people like that?"

title: Community Engagement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Waco, TX) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: got an interview set up about 2 weeks after applying, then had one hour long in person interview with two managers who had about 5 printed pages full of questions, questions were basic, behavioral, creative and mathematical. Was told I'd hear back either way in about a week. never heard back at all. was really a ridiculous amount of questions for the position i applied for.
Interview Questions: if you could be any animal would what you be, how many dollars are in 38 quarters, situation you had to take leadership in

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Denver, CO) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was called and ask for a day I was asked when I could come in for and interview. They told me who i was looking for and what time to be there. I got told the job describe. Asked about myself and what skills i may bring to the company. What I was hoping to learn for this job. Asked for my references. They contacted them and then extended me and offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Henderson, NV) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for the position via indeed. About 3 weeks later was emailed for a phone interview. Was ask the regular questions ( “ tell me a bit about yourself”). They informed me they would contact me if I moved to the second interview. A few days later they called me and asked for a second interview with the store manager. 
Went to the second interview with the store manager and the COO of the stores in the state. They asked me questions and what the position consists of. They informed me that they will make a decision at the end of the week.
Interview Questions: Do you accept change as a form of payment?.

title: Grant Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Richmond, VA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were two 30-minute phone interviews where I was asked many general, generic questions. I wish I would have been given an opportunity to share specifics about my background and how it aligned with the position.
Interview Questions: One challenging aspect of working with team

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Zero response! This is not only a problem for candidates, but for the brand. There is no excuse for so called ghosting a candidates when the organization relies uponon donations and volunteer work. Wow, just wow. My experience started when I applied on-line for a role that sounded perfect for me. Six months later, I receive a call asking if I would like to interview now for the role. I then interviewed with multiple people who seemed very kind, but never completely shut down and would not return email or calls. It is so simple: follow up. Let a candidate know if they aren't chosen or something else outside of their control such as funding dries up, etc.
Interview Questions: Ran through the job req line by line, asking about experience with each skill or experience.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Denver, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Great experience overall. Organized and sincere. Interested in wanting to make the experience the best for me. Wanted the internship to be a learning experience and interesting. Interview was very casual but they wanted to get to know me, too.
Interview Questions: What do you want to learn during your time as an intern?

title: Marketing Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was in person in their Manhattan office. When I got to the office I waited for them to come get me. The two people who interviewed me were very kind and friendly and made me feel comfortable. It felt like they wanted to get to know me and not just ask me questions and me answer. There were no outside of the box questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you seeking to leave your current position?

title: Field Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Jacksonville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Short and basic.  It was a normal conversation with two females on whic they made most of the talk to each other.  It looks like they didn’t have too much experience interviewing or it wasn’t their fortet.
Interview Questions: Tells us about yourself.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Peoria, IL) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Informal, easy questions asked and can tell interviewee was unprepared. Very basic just asked question about yourself and what was already on resume. Seems like they are not looking for much in a person at all.
Interview Questions: What skill can you bring to the organization?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Winston-Salem, NC) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: They called and asked me to come in for an interview. It felt good and there were no odd questions - very standard. I was not offered the position but only found out of this non-offer through the fact that I never received a phone call or email telling me that they were going to look elsewhere. I just wish someone had contacted me and said they didn't want to pursue me anymore.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted for an interview within a few days. My interview was with the previous Director of Development. It was a fairly casual interview with the standard questions asked about my previous experience and why I would be the best fit for the position.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a volunteer becoming upset or angry at another volunteer?

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Good. They ask good questions that prepare you for the work as well as if you are a good fit for the company and its mission. Would interview with them again.
Interview Questions: Do you handle ambiguity well?

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Palm Beach, FL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process was long and drawn out.  The hiring VP was disorganized and unprepared.   The people I interviewed with were not engaged and or knowledgeable about the role.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Habitat for Humnaity?

title: Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted about a month after I emailed my resume and asked to do a phone interview on a Monday. I was told I’d hear back by Friday, but I never did. Two weeks later I got another job and emailed them letting them know I wanted to withdraw my candidacy. I then received an email that they had moved on with another candidate. I’m not sure why this process took so long.
Interview Questions: On a scale of 1 to 10, how would you rate your experience with soliciting donations?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Charlottesville, VA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process was very mundane, very simple. This was mostly because they were actively looking for work, especially volunteer worker. The employer was very nice and asked very straight forward questions.
Interview Questions: What are you looking to accomplish during your time here?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Grass Valley, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview started with a tour of the varying locations and then involved questions from a board of directors.  Each part of the interview process took only one hour.
Interview Questions:
How would you lead change?
What is your biggest leadership failure?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Asia) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I send my application online and few weeks later they invited me to a job interview with HR. Before I had the job interview they re-post the job . The interview took 45 minutes, it was pretty easy, the HR person knew about the position so it was a mix of personal and technical questions.  He told me that in one week I would know something. It was in January and I still know nothing.  When I wrote him to ask he told the Director needed more time.  I saw re-post and re-post the position over and over again.
Interview Questions: Personal and techcnical (stress management, teamwork, examples of experience)

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Excellent experience, met with a panel of people. After the phone  screen it went pretty quick. the whole experience was not stressful at all. I received my offer letter within 48 hours.
Interview Questions: Can you multi task?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Mobile, AL)
Interview Descriptions: Informal- met with two managers separately after filling out application. Immediately I talked with each of them maybe fifteen to twenty minutes; then got a call later that afternoon asking me to start as soon as possible.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Habitat?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: It was short and simple!  I was hired on the spot.  They went over what the job entailed and the hours they wanted me to work.  They asked if I could pass a background check.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I could work a particular shift.  They asked about doing a background check on me.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview after submitting resume. 25 minutes nothing out of the ordinary. I had not submitted or viewed the online application at this point. See details under interview questions to see why I did not pursue this position further.
Interview Questions: why did you leave your last job. what are you expecting for a salary. what work experience do you feel will benefit you in this position. Have you been to restore.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Eugene, OR) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: This interview was with the Springfield-Eugene Habitat for Humanity.  A three person panel interview comprised of the Executive Director, the Volunteer Coordinator, and the Development Director--all had prepared questions.
Interview Questions: What is your experience writing and researching for grant proposals?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen. A call.with hiring manager. A week later a call with other team member. A few weeks later an interview at hq with hiring manager and second interview with other 2 team members. Then another 5 weeks to get decision.
Interview Questions: Questions were very generic, never diverged from script even when answers may have warranted a follow-up question that wasn't pre-rehearsed.

title: Longview Community Engagement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Big Sandy, TX) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I sent a resume and somebody called me for an initial interview.  And I told the person about my experience.  And I'm going to submit some writing samples with e-mail.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in writing?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Boston, MA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contact by the HR manager.  We set up an interview and she was very accommodating to my schedule-.  I met with two directors.  Came back for second interview with three directors.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this company?

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (London, ON) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview with typical middle managers. Low stress and easy. To be honest, they're desperate most of the time. When I worked there we interviewed a guy and he came in with his fly down and got the job so...
Interview Questions: Typical 'how would you handle...?' its retail.

title: Family Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Raleigh, NC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Straight-forward interview where they went over the position and learned about why I was interested/what made me qualified. Having experience in community development and speaking Spanish were pluses for working in Family Services.  I think it also helped that I have volunteered with Habitat in the past and had some personal connections.
Interview Questions: How does this internship fit in with your career goals?

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Bloomington, IL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: They were really accommodating when setting up the interview. It was a full panel interview with multiple staff members and Board members present. Each person asked multiple questions. There was only one round of interviews, but they mentioned a potential second round if deemed necessary.
Interview Questions: How are you in dealing with people from different faiths?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: it is simple,just go online,watch small safety movies,answer the safety quiz and u r ready to work.After  clearing the safety quiz a link is sent  to you ,u can log in by making your ID and choose the shift u want to work.
Interview Questions: safety questions

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Silver Spring, MD) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was three rounds - first on the phone, then in person with the development team and supervisor, then I met with the Executive Director. Took a couple weeks to go through it all.
Interview Questions: How will your experience help you perform this job?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Grand Junction, CO) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: thay introduce me to the difternt seccesions greeen red blue  yelow ("i loved the prosses thair was no hard ball questions it was licke peas in a pod i vonlenter at habatat
Interview Questions: will i work

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Fort Pierce, FL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people, made me feel very comfortable during the whole process. I hope to get a job with this company as soon as possible. The office was very clean and professional looking, I think they know what they’re doing.
Interview Questions: Q: give us an examp,e of a time you went above and beyond for a coworker?

title: Crew Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: ou will be responsible for working together with the Special Events team to coordinate annual fundraising events with all aspects related to the execution of these events as well as additional development projects
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Day Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (San Antonio, TX) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. I met with the boss on site and talked to him about setting up the interview. He gave me his card and we were able to set one up. It took me a while to get started with leading because I had to wait for an available house. But other than that I love my job and love working with the staff and homeowners.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Dallas, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview went well with the HR representative, followed by a second in-person interview with the development supervisor -- was told a third interview with other development associate staff would be follow if candidacy was to proceeds. Both interviews went very smoothly and provided great company culture.  Still waiting and looking forward to their response.
Interview Questions: Development history. Donor portfolio.

title: Repair Foreman Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed at the Oakland office.  It's a little difficult to find if you have never been their so give yourself a little time.  It's actually in the beautiful church you'll see on the corner.

First I had a phone conversation with HR. I was told she would forward my resume to the appropriate place and she did!  I revived a phone interview later in the week.  After the phone interview I was called and asked to come in for a face 2 face a few days later.

At the interview,  I met with three different people.  The first person I met be my direct supervisor then the next two were his supervisors.  Originally I was to also interview with someone involved in the hiring process but they weren't available that day.  Things happen, I just really appreciate their transparency. 

However all three people I met with would be wonderfull to work, likeminded intelligent and professional.  

After the end of the rather thorough three hour interview I felt as if my experience was perfect and that I would make a great member of the team.  I definitely impressed mysel!  

At the end of the interview my potential supervisor was instructed to take me to meet the HR rep.  I felt as if this was a good sign however unfortunately I wasn't told when or if I would be notified of the decision.  I maybe should have been direct.  I am currently mulling over and delaying as best I can a job opportunity that is far more money but doesn't have what Habitat has. 

The people and the passion to do what I know I was meant to do.  

Well we'll see. Good luck
Interview Questions: How could you motivate a volunteer that wasn't neccesarialy motivated to help the cause.

title: Human Resources Interview Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: HR Director missed my interview on 3 different occasions and never made an effort to give me a proper date when it was rescheduled. She just said expect a call in the afternoon. The most unprofessional interviewing experience I've ever had
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Long interview process, hard to get the manager on the phone after the call you and leave a message.  Clearly didn't care about the candidate experience because they could never confirm an interview and expected you as the interviewee to just be ok with it.  Sorry we're just busy right now was the answer.
Interview Questions: How would you handle working on multiple different project with multiple different deadlines and all needing to be completed right away?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR, then phone interview with hiring manager. They wanted to know if I would be comfortable with a high stress environment with many moving parts. It was conversational.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself in 3 words, why do you want this job, why are you leaving your current job?

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were three interviews.  1. an initial phone screen.  2. a phone call with one current employee 3. an in person panel interview.  The in person panel interview consisted of three other potential coworkers and the person exiting the position I was applying for.
Interview Questions: Many situational questions were asked such as tell us a time when you.... or tell us about a time when you handled a challenge at work.

title: Homeowner Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Applied via career website -> phone interview by the manager within a few days -> scheduled an on-site interview -> manager explaining the details of the job -> 1st manager interviewed me -> another manager interviewed me -> both interviewed me at the same time -> Done!
Interview Questions: What does our organization do?

title: Institutional Research Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Tyler, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Moderately formal, but friendly and focused on skills, potential for the organization, and personal integrity. They looked for a balance of skill, honesty, and your work ethic, which must be solid.
Interview Questions: What is your educational background?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Kamloops, BC) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed by the Executive Director and Store Manager. they were very personable and seemed like and amazing team to work with
the starting wage is very low, understandable with non-profit, but to recruit the right fit, sometimes spending more can be better
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Habitat?

title: Customer Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Kelso, WA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was seclude for my interview at 9:30 at Habitat for Humanity.  I was on time. Dressed for success. My interview went very well.  He hired me for a part time position. I will start tomorrow and work 20 hours a week. He review all the Hazards assonated with the Job. Dewayne was very professional and respectful.
Interview Questions: What would like to learn from this Job.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions:
I just exchanged some Emails with Habitat. I didn't have any real interviews.
They are happy to welcome as many volunteers as possible. But make no mistake, if you commit yourself to work, even as a volunteer, you'll have to work seriously and follow orders.
Interview Questions: They just wanted to know what were my physical abilities to make sure they didn't give things too complicated or dangerous to do.

title: Homeownership Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Portland, OR) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: They interviewed me over the phone, which I felt went very well.  They told me at the end of the phone interview, that I was one of the top candidates, due to my experience in the field, and community.  I was also told the next step would be an in person interview with the executive director and some board members.  I never heard back from them, despite placing several calls. Because they were a community partner of the non-profit where I worked at the time, I heard who that they hired internally - from the person they hired.  To me, it felt extremely unprofessional to not give me the courtesy of a "we've decided to go a different direction" phone call - particularly considering they tabled at an event held by my then current employer that same month.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have supporting new immigrants as they work toward homeownership?

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Friendly initial phone interview, then I was recommended for a second interview, hopefully I will be referred for an in person interview. the website prepared me well. However you need to know how well you work with a team.
Interview Questions: what motivates you to come to work everyday

title: Fund Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth process. Contacted 2 weeks after closing date of posting to have a phone interview the following week. Interviewer called on time and was very polite. I was asked a few typical questions and then allowed time for questions. It was a short interview but that could be because my answers were fairly concise.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Habitat for Humanity?

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (London, ON) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very short interview with high level questions.  Was offered the position right after the interview. I had done some research on the organization ahead of time and went prepared with their past and current projects, also noted that they had amalgamated with three other smaller Habitat locations and brainstormed some potential fundraising and marketing ideas for them.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a successful fundraising event that you organized.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Santa Barbara, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview for the internship, but the employer told me information their organization and the job description. The employer mentioned what they expect me to do for the internship.
Interview Questions: There was no interview question.

title: Community Outreach Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Canton, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed within a couple of days to go in for an interview the next week.  The interview was very informal.  Two girls interviewed me on a set of couches in a large, shared office.  They didn't ask me any questions that were difficult to answer.
Interview Questions:
The girls who interviewed me did not seem to have a list of questions.  They mostly talked about Habitat for Humanity and what the person hired would do in this particular role, and then would just ask me something like, "What do you think about doing that?" or "How would you feel about ___?"  There were not any difficult questions, and I did not have many opportunities to speak, as most of the time was spent with the two girls explaining things that I had already read about on the website and in the job description.

I had read about other interviews on Glassdoor and felt what was said about interviewing for Habitat was pretty accurate to my experience.

title: Construction Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Very relaxed interview. 3 way questions and answers. Manager and Director were very nice. 
Interview took about 40 minutes. Request for background check and drug test came about 10 days after initial interview.
Interview Questions: Previous experience?

title: Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Kamloops, BC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Normal. Very standard interview process. Typical questions like describe X situation and how you managed X. Group papal interview with final decision being the board of directors. The ED makes recommendations and then they vote.
Interview Questions: Typical questions easy to prepare for. Just need to show passion.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very casual. They have high turn over for roles. Were looking for people who would stay longer than a year. They were interested in my background and ability to lift over 50 pounds. Wanted to know my hobbies and my personality. To get along with the team. The interview was laid back and they did not have a lot of qualified candidates.. i'm assuming.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict between team members?

title: Business Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (New Rochelle, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Sat in the office until it was my turn to interview. When i did, they interviewed me  and wanted to see if I knew the organization and was interested in working for  a non for profit organization.
Interview Questions: What is Habitat for Humanity's mission?

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Went back for a second interview with Manager and Director, as well as board president. Interview was 20+minutes.
