Many questions regarding interacting with volunteers and prior employees, coming in as a new (and younger) assistant manager. Overall, good (but nerve-wracking) experience.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a disagreement with a volunteer that has been here for a while? A Customer?

title: Monitoring and Evaluation Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Nairobi) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Short interview on phone. Followed by Face to face, with three members of the project team, whom if i got the job would work with. The three members each asked me a set of questions one after the other. Some of the questions asked was if i ever worked in an NGO, and how my experiences will add value to the organization. I was then given time to ask questions and concerns.
Interview Questions:
How good are my interaction skills?
Computer and reporting skills

title: Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Austin, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: We went and had coffee, discussed the role and whether or not I was a fit for it. It was determined that I was and now I sit here at my desk typing this. I really don't have much to say but I have to hit a 30 word min. It was very informal, as are most interviews in real estate development.
Interview Questions: informal interview

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: There was a Phone call first that latest about 5 minutes. I was then asked to a face to face meeting with the senior director. The interview was not at all what I expected. I had worked with habitat before as a volunteer and i felt like they were unprepared for me. They asked me very basic questions. Nothing specific to my past experiences or how I could fit this position. I was not impressed.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute here?

title: Warehouse Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Casselberry, FL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and very personal. The interviewer made you feel at home. I was asked why I wanted to work there, if I knew what Habitats goals were, what makes me think I'm suited to work this job. I was also asked about my background/things listed on my resume.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for the Habitat ReStore?

title: Retail Sales Associate Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Cary, NC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Management explained history and culture of company and explained the job role. Introduced to other team members as well as the facility. Manager provided feedback and answered questions in a very pleasant informative manner.
Interview Questions:
Why volunteer?
Why volunteer here?
Identify past experiences that relate?
Explain experience in working closely with others?
identified shifts, hours available.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: within few days i applied online, I did phone interview with CFO.  Few days later, in person interview with CFO.  Few days later, in person interview with executive director.
Interview Questions: Reason for applying for the position

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Saint Paul, MN) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with a supervisor to explore interests and see if there were projects that would benefit both parties. The interview itself was very laid back and mostly used to determine areas of need within the organization and how I might best use my skills to help them.
Interview Questions: What are academic projects you've worked on in the past year?

title: Driver Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (McDonough, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The store needed employees so the hiring process was quick and incredibly easy and friendly. I met with two people overall, one from HR and another was my store manager. They sat me in a room in the store I was working and the atmosphere was light and relaxing.
Interview Questions: What is important to remember when you go out on the truck and meet donors face to face to pick up donations?

title: Capacity Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Bangkok) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The first round of interview was just a basic HR interview asking why i wanted the job and what skills i had to handle the job. Though it ended positively i did not hear back from them for a month. The second round interview was at their office. Two out of three panelists joined and then one of them left midway! The questions they asked were all about my past experience to see how it would fit into their requirements. They were pleasant and it felt more like having a conversation. After the first panel there was another panel where again only one out of two people joined....it was very basic and conversational. However they did not bother to get back on the results for about 2 months.
Interview Questions: what is your experience in capacity building?

title: Retail Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Denver, CO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: A short interview with the store manager of the store I had applied for. The interview was short and sweet because the staff at Habitat already knew what my skills were.
Interview Questions: What can you do for the company?

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screen with Habitat for a marketing director position. The human resources rep with whom I spoke was very good. He described the position and was willing to talk about the culture. He asked standard questions for a phone screen style interview, including what I already knew about Habitat for Humanity. Also asked about why I'm thinking of leaving my current job.
Interview Questions: Asked me about my strengths and for an example of where I applied that strength.

title: Mortgage Servicing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone interview with hiring manager- very informal 
2. Face to Face with hiring manager and HR-formal  but not hard just went over past experiences and how it related to position I was applying for
3. Face to Face with VP -Simple for like a conversation to see if I would fit in 
4. Face to Face with CEO- Just a formality
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to handle multiple projects at once?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online received a phone call the next day. Called back the next day had a 15 minute interview. Pay was well below average even for a non profit. I read the over reviews and they are accurate.
Interview Questions: Why non profit?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Aurora, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was initially called and he wanted to do a phone interview.  I had time when he called, but that didn't give me any time to prep.  I was asked to come in two days late for an interview with the general manager.  I got there 10-15 min early (seemed like I was inconveniencing him by being early) we did the interview. And even though I was told and the posting said it was a full time position,  the manager said it was part time.  He also made me full or the application again.
Interview Questions: what do you dislike most about your current job?

title: GIS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I got an email for an on site interview with options for interview time. There are four people interviewed, the atmosphere is not easy going. After one week, I sent an email asking for the result and get a positive answer.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself and what do you know about GIS.

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (College Station, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly environment.The stuffs were welcoming and friendly as well. The hiring manager only asked me a few questions about myself and career goals and told me I was hired right then.
Interview Questions: About myself, my career goals

title: GIS Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Their process is simple. Probably due to it is an intern, not so competitive compare to a real job. One round interview with their manager, HR and two other staffs.
Interview Questions: Most of questions are related to technics. They are trying to figure out if you have the skills to complete their daily jobs.

title: Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Cincinnati, OH) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 in-person interviews scheduled. One was with the direct supervisor for the position and the other included the HR manager. Both interviewees were very nice and made it the process comfortable.
Interview Questions: Why Habitat?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: I had applied via the career services department at my university, where they did the first round of interviewing. The people who made it to the second round were then interviewed by Habitat for Humanity directors at their offices. They were really good at communicating with me before my interview. When I arrived and got settled into the meeting room, everything went smoothly. They're really nice and willing to answer any of your questions.
Interview Questions: There weren't any unexpected questions.

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: First round, phone screening with an HR rep, basic questions. Second round, phone interview with boss and team. More detailed questions and opportunity to engage. Third round, in-person at the office with both HR and Boss/team.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard questions - strengths/weaknesses, why do you want this job, what ideas do you bring to the table.

title: Truck Driver/Donation Pick Up Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Dade City, FL) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied at a local job fair. Was given an on the spot interview. The interview was brief and the person interviewing me told me they'd give me a call in a week or so. Two weeks go by and then I'm finally called back and given the first of two interviews. I was asked typical questions about my background and driving record. Told them everything was clean. The person interviewing me seemed impressed and said they'd call me soon about a second interview. Another two weeks go by and I'm called again for the second interview. This time I'm interviewed by a different manager. I'm pretty much asked the same questions all over again. Strangely I'm also asked questions that have absolutely nothing to do with the job I'm applying for.
Interview Questions: Asked questions about experience that was irrelevant to the said job I had applied for.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: After submitting resume and cover letter, the first interview was with director and I received a tour of the operations. They requested to see samples of my work. The second with representatives of several departments.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply to the organization?

title: Social Media Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: job was posted on kijiji, application process to time of call for interview was at least 2 weeks, interviewed before Christmas holidays and wasy noit hired on until early January, was pretty painless after that
Interview Questions: nothing out of the ordinary

title: Real Estate and Construction Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (New York, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Scattered, lengthy (3+ interviews over a 2+ month period), and deceptive. Managers did not reveal that the organization was having serious senior management troubles that left the NYC office without a CEO for over a year.
Interview Questions: Have you had prior affordable housing experience?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Started as volunteer and got to know the organization. Researched the company. Met with the staff and work-sites. No need to meet with the BOD for this position. Gave me the basic job functions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Construction Volunteer Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted a week later for a phone interview.  Phone interview consisted of questions about previous work experience, willingness to participate in educational activities and workshops outside of construction work. I was asked mainly about previous leadership and volunteer management experience. Half of the interview contained questions  about me and the other half was informational about the position and company.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: ReStore Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: You will have to meet the a panel of store manager, Human Resources, Resource director, Business analyst. Be prepared to discuss your work history, management style, your strengths and weaknesses, your plans to change the culture and work with volunteers.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very quick. I was contacted for an interview and within a week, I had Skyped with two employees and was offered the position. This was several months after applying though. The Skype interview was casual and more conversational. They were very friendly and the questions were relatively predictable.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with multiple projects at once?

title: Video Editor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: It took a long time to go through the hiring process, but it paid off in the end. People were very friendly and gave me a good idea of what to expect with the job. I interviewed and met with almost everyone on the creative team before being offered the job.
Interview Questions: Why work for an non-profit?

title: Specialist- Volunteer Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied a week ago and received a phone call from the hiring department. She was very nice and wanted to go over a few questions with me. The phone interview was formal with a casual tone. I was asked about my abilities, experience, and what I would be expected to add to the organization. From there we went over my salary expectations, and benefits package. We went over my availability and am expected to hear from them in the next few days about a possible second interview, in person, with the youth departments hiring person.
Interview Questions: No unexpected or difficult questions. Just know what you bring to the table and you'll be fine.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Had a phone interview with HR and two weeks later contacted for an in person interview with HR two person team, Finance Director and three other managers in finance.  Was there for about four hours.  
didn't hear from them again until maybe 2-3 weeks later with a job offer which I accepted.
Interview Questions: Not difficult, the usual questions about your background and what you are looking to do.

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for a Volunteer Coordinator position. Went right to an in-person interview without conducting a phone interview. The staff seemed competent and friendly - low pressure.  They ended up hiring internally so it seemed a bit like they were interviewing a few people to go through the motions. The job sounded like it was primarily paperwork/data entry focused due to their high volume of volunteers. I was more interested in the interaction aspect.
Interview Questions: Asked the usual - How have you handled a difficult situation with a volunteer, What are you most/least excited about, what motivates you...no curveballs.

title: Resource Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Received an email from the ED requesting a phone interview which occurred the following week.   Very friendly, knowledgable 35 minute phone interview followed by an in person with director of finance.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Specialist, Knowledge Sharing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process is very slow going. In the company's defense, the HR process involves upper level management, including the CEO, reviewing every candidate for every position. In some ways that is nice that everyone is involved in hiring, but it does slow the hiring process down very much. 

I interviewed with HR for a position in April by phone, followed by another phone interview with the hiring manager in May. I was told it would take a couple of months before I would hear back. Finally, I was contacted in late July to interview in person in August. Once I interviewed in person, it took another 6 weeks for an offer to be made. 

I understand that my interview process took slightly longer than others, but don't be surprised if interviews take months to completed. At least the HR team usually informs you the steps along the way so you are not caught off guard.
Interview Questions: The questions were pretty typical of any interview. The thing they seemed to focus on for me was my willingness to learn new technologies and how the position would challenge me or help me grow professionally.

title: Develoopment and Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at a profession placement company that then sent my resume to Habitat. My resume was sent to Habitat and the interview schedule quickly. It was a temp to perm position. I was hired hired the next day.
Interview Questions: Competency in Raiser's Edge.

title: Management Assistent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (The Hague) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Ging super snel, binnen een week wist ik al of ik de baan had of niet. 
Online gesolliciteerd en kreeg direct een ontvangstbevestiging en dat er binnen 2 werkdagen contact met mij opgenomen zou worden. 3 dagen later maakten we een afspraak voor de sollicitatie en die had ik met twee werkgevers; Operationeel Manager en de Management Assistent.
Interview Questions:
Veel vragen over je persoonlijkheid en wat je ambities zijn. 
Waar zie jij jezelf over 5 jaar, hoe reageer je in stressvolle situaties?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Reviewed qualifications and skills, informative on responsibilities of the position. Interest in HfH was questioned in the interview and the necessary ethical responsibilities of the position were also reviewed. Interview was casual yet be prepared to discuss your skills and qualifications. Second interview is likely necessary if you are being considered.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with non-profits?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Troy, OH) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: First interview was pretty informal, one on one with the Executive Director.  2nd interview 1 week later was with the E.D. and Board President and contained some good behavioral type questions.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you came to work and there was no enough manpower to run operations?

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Seoul) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: applying resume by online, 2 times interviews in a week. las result will get in a month. no salary negotiation. if you want to know, you have to ask first
Interview Questions: talking about future strategy for NGOs

title: Web Content Editor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took a while.  I applied for the job online and then didn't hear back from anyone for a couple of months.  After that, though, things moved pretty quickly.  I interviewed with 5 people, I think -- the communications director, a few editors, and the web developers.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: The interview was brief and in person.
Interview Questions: The interviewer kept to standard interview questions regarding my competencies and job responsibilities. Nothing our of the ordinary was discussed.

title: Family Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Winston-Salem, NC) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a wonderful experience. The Director of Family Services interviewed and hired me. We had an hour interview.   In which, we spoke on my  many skills and work experience. We immediately took a liking to each other and seem to have a connection. We both knew this was the job for me.
Interview Questions: Work ethics seem to be very important in the company.

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Flint, MI) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went as follows... Walked in the door. Asked to see the General Manager.  Talked with him  for about ten minutes.  He asked if I was willing to work today.  I said yes.  I was hired on the spot as a volunteer for Habitat for Humanity ReStore.
Interview Questions: am I a hard worker?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Lorain, OH) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was through Mature Services. It was comprehensive as to my employment experience, my expectations for employment, and how I would be assisted in future employment opportunities with Mature Services and For Profit organizations.
Interview Questions: There were none per se, but I did feel that I would like to stay with the Not For Profit organizational opportunities available. At my age I do not really want to be employed in other venues.

title: Construction Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews both with several interviewers asking questions.  Members of the board of directors, executive director, and construction committee members were all there.
Interview Questions: How would you conduct a days work with 30 volunteers, what would that day look like if your were framing/or painting/or interior work.

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Bay Saint Louis, MS) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with the Board of Directors after submitting a resume strong with community activism. This was at a Habitat affiliate not the Habitat International which is somewhat of an umbrella organization.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work for a non-profit.

title: Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Tacoma, WA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. I was interviewed by the HR manager as well as the CFO for the local affiliate. Amazing people. Made the interview really informal and comfortable. They asked me basic questions about my skills with the Microsoft suite especially including excel. They are looking for someone who is willing to learn and were very open about the training. Everyone is ready and available if you should require any assistance on a task.
Interview Questions: Are you an good with excel (i.e. pivot tables)

title: Construction Crew Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was relatively fast. I applied online and received an email the next day. The interview was on the easy side and felt more like a conversation than an interrogation. Leading skilled and unskilled volunteers was a major component of the job and was highlighted thoroughly.  I was offered the position within two weeks.
Interview Questions: Why a nonprofit vs. a private construction company?

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: Conducted completely over phone interviews due to distance. First interview asked questions about my experience and a few personal questions. A few emails asking for more of my portfolio. A second interview was conducted with more leadership members present.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had several rounds of interviewing. I first spoke with an HR representative by phone then met in person with a panel of potential team members. After that, I met in person with head of department. The timing did not feel rushed and I enjoyed the opportunity to meet many people.
Interview Questions: What attracts you to this organization? How did you decide to apply?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Memphis, TN) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: job was posted online, sent in resume got called in for interview. interviewed with one person. pretty straight forward questions. got a tour of the building & introduced to other employees. got an email with an offer a few days later.
Interview Questions: asked for samples of previous work and detailed questions about previous experience

title: Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I came to the place.  Talked to the manger at first, and gave them my resume as well as cover letter.  I flared it up a little bit, and made it look very good.  The manager gave me a call and wanted to meet in person and he was very helpful and nice during the interview.
Interview Questions: What type of pieces are these

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Huntsville, AL) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: interview was long, but it was very professional. The process took about 45 minutes and was mostly me answering questions about leadership, and responsibility. It was a fairly lengthy interview but i thought it was well performed and i respected the two individuals who interviewed me.
Interview Questions: Give an example of when you had to lead a project.

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, low pressure, friendy and comfortable environment. Just two staff members, made me feel less nervous by how human and friendly they were. No long questionaires, no drug tests, all happened within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Problem solving

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Budapest)
Interview Descriptions: Very fast interview process. Written test and two face to face interviews
Interview Questions: What are my views on religion

title: Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and immediately was called and had a phone interview with a member of HR.  Basic questions (why do you want this job? what are you doing now?)  Was called back days later and asked to come in for a face-to-face interview with three different attorneys.  I thought the interviews went quite well, and was in the main office for over three hours.  I followed up with the HR contact every other week for about a month and a half.  Was given cursory responses.  After about three months (and me finally just giving up on the job) I was told the company had decided not to hire anyone for the position.  I guess business is business but it would have been nice to have been at least given a "thank you for your time and interest."
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable working in a Christian based workplace?

title: M & E Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Lilongwe) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called by phone to come attend the interview on a specified date and to bring along all my original copies of certification. I was then invited for the panel interviews where questions were asked and I responded. I was informed I will be notified of the results once the decision was made.
Interview Questions: Share your experience in the M & E field.

title: Product Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview, very intense. Asked detailed questions about how you work
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Americus, GA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening by HR, then short phone conversation with hiring manager, then an in-person panel interview with manager and peers. Questions tended to be general. They asked for examples but did not drill down to follow-up questions. It is important to charm HR representative, as they provide a recommendation, but they know little about the job or wider office culture. It is also important to express revere for the Habitat mission and reputation, as it is valued above all by management. Flatter them by talking about your emotional connection to the mission, and you will have a far greater chance of being hired.
Interview Questions: What would a colleague say is their favorite thing about working with you? Their least favorite?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Austin, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: easy
Interview Questions: how many hours are you able to work a week?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview to reduce the number of applicants.  Then was given a panel interview.  Phone interview went extremely well in my view.  Then face to face interview also went well even though I felt a little nervous.  I prepared by going online and doing research on the non-profit organization as well as interview questions.  I felt prepared.  Was made to feel at ease with the interviewers and felt I did well.
Interview Questions: How well do you work with diversity with individuals.

title: Volunteer Builder Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Yonkers, NY) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: The person I spoke to was in charge of the entire site in Yonkers, NY. He was friendly and very happy to hear that I was interested in volunteering. I was immediately hired after speaking to him on the phone and was invited to come to the workplace as soon as I was free. Not a hard interview in any way, shape, or form.
Interview Questions: How did you learn about us?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then two in person interviews; one with a panel. The phone interview was very basic and easy. The in person interview was casual and pretty laid back. When I got to the panel interview there was really only one person interviewing me so it wasn't clear why the others needed to sit in.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to the company? Why do you want to get involved with Habitat? How do you deal with stressful situations?

title: Head Cashier/Floor Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: i volunteered there for 7 months prior to employment, I was offered the job based on my work ethic and the love of the mission..Habitat for Humanity hired me , I was elated, then administration hired someone who destroyed the whole atmosphere of a great lace to be involved with.
Interview Questions: would I settle for the small pay scale?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen with HR before brought into the office for interviews. Almost solid 8 hours of interviews (with a break at lunch time) with various staff (potential coworkers, hiring manager, manager's manager). I was an internal candidate so I knew everyone interviewing me, but was put through the same hiring process as external candidates.
Interview Questions: How does your degree (BA in English) apply to this position?

title: President Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Jacksonville, FL) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Referred to affiliate by existing board member. No formal process for hiring. Was hired as the original employee at a very low annual salary. Board members were not exactly clear of their goals for the first hire. Because of this was able to develop my own organization
Interview Questions: None. Lack of clarity on job content was the major obstacle. Had to create my own direction during the interview. This worked since the measurable outcomes did not yet exist.

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: I met with a group of six different people for about an hour each and had casual behavior based questions.  I had lunch with the hiring manager.  After the interview it took another couple weeks before the offer was made.
Interview Questions: Why non-profit?

title: ReStore Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Williamsport, PA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by Operations Director for interview.  Very pleasant person who conducted an enjoyable interview.  Asked me numerous manager and sales related questions.  Gave me a facility tour and introduced me to volunteers and the executive director. .  Also had other people waiting for interviews in the lobby.  The end result was that the monetary offer was far below what I needed to take care of my family and the offer was FIRM.  I also felt that he person they were looking for would have no ability to exercise creativity in the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Construction Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Orlando, FL) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by members of the Board of Directors. They were more concerned about my experience and did not do a great job of explain the role and job description. Only later was this explained by the fact that the B.O.D. was really not involved in the day to day of the affiliate. As such the affiliate was in disarray but this only became evident after being hired.
Interview Questions: There were no questions that caught me off guard or were unexpected.

title: Controller Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of an initial general phone interview followed by a 3 person panel interview.  The questions were general in nature with the exception of questions regarding accounting software conversions.  The Organization will be implementing MIP in the next 6 months and would like to hire someone with conversion experience.
Interview Questions: What type of experience have you had with accounting software conversions?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Chambersburg, PA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Initial communication: I sent resume and cover letter through USPS. Chair of search committee replied with interview date and time, leaving messages via email and voice mail.

The group did not seem to view the position as significant, as they scheduled a series of candidate interviews in consecutive blocks of 30 minutes each.

Members of the search committee were very pleasant. They stated that they were physically tired from the effort of holding up the organization and recognized a need for changed management style. However, they did not appear ready to professionalize the position. 

In fact, they opened the interview with the statement that they were looking for full-time accomplishments on part-time hours.

I was told that I came second. I would have liked the job, but it would have been very low-ball in terms of pay.
Interview Questions: What is Toastmasters (the volunteer organization mentioned on my resume)

title: Family Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. First interview was on the phone. Second was face to face. The third is with the whole staff.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have when it comes to working with low income families?

title: ETL Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: It took about 4-5 weeks for HR to call me after submitting my resume. The interview was one on one with hiring manager. I had to call and send e-mail to ask about further interviewing and was finally informed that I was not being considered. Overall the experience was positive.
Interview Questions: What makes a good ETL design?

title: Office Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Lancaster, PA) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: applied through state job bank, where opening was listed.  got a call for an interview, was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Position posted online, but not on organization website. Submitted resume and references which generated a response via telephone. A brief telephone interview was conducted, followed by reference checks. Face-to-face interview was held a few weeks later. Offer made within a couple of days and was contingent on clean background check.
Interview Questions: I do not recall any questions as being odd, unexpected or difficult.

title: I Was A Volunteer and They Offered Me A Position Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Orlando, FL) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was there to complete community service as a volunteer with Habitat for Humanity when they realized my skill set and offered me a position. I accepted and began to work with the company on the floor by selling and organizing incoming products.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Ajwa Restaurant and marriage Garden) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: I had anounce my retirement from the Habitat affiliate I was currently working for and was immediately approached by the Board Chair and ED of the nieghboring  affiliate.  We met the following noon over lunch.  The questions were very specific and much as to be expected.  I had had previouse history with this affilate and know all parties involved very well.
Interview Questions: Can You start the day following you retirement?

title: Resource Development Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Habitat for Humanity (Newland, NC) in Feb 2007
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was quite long and rather confusing. It consisted of several emails back and forth with the Executive Director, a 1:1 interview with the Executive Director, and a panel interview with members of the Board of Directors. I was also required to attend a board meeting with another candidate, which was rather unusual.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your previous fundraising experience...what percent of grants that you wrote were funded?
